cleaned_text: Maria E. Gannon, MS.,L.Ac., NCCAOM Acupuncturist Cupping Moxa Tuning Forks Tuina Facial Gua Sha Maria Gannon received her Masters of Science in Acupuncture from Tri-State College of Acupuncture in Manhattan. She also holds a Bachelor of Science in Marketing from La Salle University in Philadelphia. A native of Northeast Philadelphia, Maria attended St. Christopher Grade School and Saint Basil Academy High School. Upon graduating from acupuncture school, she began an intensive full-time three-year externship studying holistic health care. In addition to acupuncture, Maria has also studied homeopathy, herbal medicine, Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), and other non-prescription and non-invasive forms of pain and symptomatic relief. Maria also attended classes at The National Center for Homeopathy, as well as home study groups for the same. She learned Qigong to hasten the healing of several personal medical issues and now incorporates it in her practice. Everyone knows that stress can cause a myriad of physical and mental health issues. Did you know that [acupuncture has been used to relieve stress ](https://www.healthline.com/health/acupuncture-for-stress#:~:text=%E2%80%9CAcupuncture%20has%20been%20shown%20in,and%20anxiety%2C%E2%80%9D%20she%20says.)for thousands of years? Acupuncture isn't just for injuries, it can help solve many of life's everyday challenges. Find out for yourself if this type of holistic treatment is right for you
